page.title: 01Lianynys
page.content: { {Llanynys is a parish 3 miles NNW of {Ruthin and is rich in historical and {antiquarian associations. {It is recorded that the King's troops {Marched to Plas y Ward on October 26 {1645. The original name of the Parish {was Llansaeran after it's patron {saint St.Saern. {The Parish was then and still is {primarily agricultiral, lying within {the verdant Vale of Clwyd. } Large estates abound in the Vale _ now generally subdivided into smaller farms of 150-250 acres or so. Our grid encompasses both hill and valley farms. The villages of Rhewl,Llanrhaeadr & Llanynys serve this traditionally Welsh community.
